message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the analysis of natural language text using computational methods, which is a common theme in the field of natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a model and algorithmic framework, which involves machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, making cs.AI another likely sub-category. The use of hypergraphs as a representation model involves graph theory and machine learning, which are also relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.SI (social and information networks). Finally, the paper deals with knowledge inference and summarization, which are related to information retrieval (IR) techniques, making cs.IR a possible sub-category as well.
